description: From New Latin edema, from Ancient Greek οἴδημα (oídēma, “swelling”), from οἰδέω (oidéō, “I swell”).

entries.meaning: (American spelling, pathology) An excessive accumulation of serum in tissue spaces or a body cavity.
examples: In the patients with myocardial edemas [247, 471] it was shown that, despite a considerable loss of fluid via the kidneys after the intravenous administration of a short-acting and very effective diuretic (furosemide), there was no increase in the blood and plasma viscosities.

entries.meaning: (American spelling, botany) A similar swelling in plants caused by excessive accumulation of water.
